trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationInput"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationOutput"></xref> messages related to an XML Web service.
This class cannot be inherited.
An instance of this class will be returned by the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation.Messages%2A> property of the parent <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.Operation>.
As such, it can have exactly two members, one an <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.OperationInput> and the other an <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.OperationOutput>.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessage"></xref> to the end of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessageCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessage"></xref> to add to the collection.
The zero-based index where the operationMessage parameter has been added.

Determines whether the specified <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessage"></xref> is a member of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessageCollection"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessage"></xref> for which to check collection membership.
`true` if the operationMessage parameter is a member of the ; otherwise, `false`.

Copies the entire <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessageCollection"></xref> to a compatible one-dimensional array of type <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessage"></xref>, starting at the specified zero-based index of the target array.
An array of type <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessage"></xref> serving as the destination for the copy action.
The zero-based index at which to start placing the copied collection.
Gets the type of transmission supported by the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessageCollection"></xref>.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationFlow"></xref> values.
The default is `SolicitResponse`.
Searches for the specified <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessage"></xref> and returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence within the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessage"></xref> for which to search in the collection.
The zero-based index of the specified operation message, or -1 if the element was not found in the collection.
Gets the first occurrence of an <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationInput"></xref> within the collection.
An <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationInput"></xref> within the collection.

Adds the specified <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessage"></xref> to the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessageCollection"></xref> at the specified zero-based index.
If the number of items in the collection already equals the collection's capacity, the capacity is doubled by automatically reallocating the internal array before the new element is inserted.
If the `index` parameter is equal to <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A>, the `operationMessage` parameter is added to the end of the collection.
The elements after the insertion point move down to accommodate the new element.
The zero-based index at which to insert the operationMessage parameter.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessage"></xref> to add to the collection.
Gets or sets the value of an <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessage"></xref> at the specified zero-based index.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessage"></xref> whose value is modified or returned.
An `OperationMessage` at the specified zero-based index.
Gets the first occurrence of an <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationOutput"></xref> within the collection.
An <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationOutput"></xref> within the collection.

Removes the first occurrence of the specified <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessage"></xref> from the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessageCollection"></xref>.
This method performs a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.Count%2A>.
The elements that follow the removed <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessage> move up to occupy the vacated spot.
The <xref href="System.Web.Services.Description.OperationMessage"></xref> to remove from the collection.
